name: Aaron g
text:
So i have heard about this place a couple times when i searched for something to eat while up in the waterloo area and well today was the day i stopped in about 8:45am and let me tell you this. IT WAS TRUELY AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE!! The customer service the food the hospitality that i experienced when there was truely one of a kind i stayed there for about almost 3 hours just talking and eating shareing stories and just enoying the time there you feel like family when you go there. Its fresh food if your gonna go there thinking your gonna go in and get out then go to McDonald's or somewhere else if you want something that is fresh and made with love and care THEN THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU.

What i ate was the breakfast plate 2 eggs bacon cathead biscuit and hash browns get the sausage gravy on the biscuit it was the best i had anywhere so far i can not put enough emphasis on how great it was. Im gonna be trying to go every weekend for me its a 40 minute drive to get there and worth every minute and any amount of fuel to get there.

Must go to place hands down go as friends leave as family.

name: Michael Jensen
text: Rebecca's Diner sits at the old Big Daddy's location on Main Street in Warrior. The owners have painstakingly renovated the entire building. Everything is immaculate with a wonderful atmosphere. It is a mix of an old style diner and a modern eatery. I got the club sandwich with fries. The sandwich was a hearty size with three pieces of bread, large chunks of bacon, and slices of fried ham and turkey. Everything was cooked fresh so be prepared for a wait. Good food takes time! Unfortunately I could not try the Philly because they sold out by the end of day! I think that says plenty about the immediate popularity of the shop. If you are driving through Warrior come by for a delicious bite.

name: Elaine Brown Barnes
text: Well worth the stop! I had yams, speckled butter beans, collard greens, and creamed corn and would have sworn my grandmother cooked it. I'm looking forward to their cheeseburger on our next trip. It looked wonderful. We plan on making this a regular stop on any trip that brings us close. If you want great 'home cooked' food, a bright, clean diner atmosphere with friendly service, this is the place for you!

name: Nina Larsrn
text: The best thing about the the menu is the Patty Melt and French Fries other than that everything is out of a can and PKG gravy. I asked the waitress if the so called homemade Banana pudding was really homemade and she said yes, well it was instant pudding with some wafers. Very small portions for the price. But the people are extremely nice and friendly. I was really hoping for more homemade food coming from such a small family owned cafe

text: Called in a togo order due to not being able to dine in.  I basically ordered pasta with the sauce on the side & plain bread.  The 1st order came with the sauce on the pasta.  The 2nd order was rushed and the sides we over cooked. It also came with garlic bread.  It took three trys to get it looking right. Three times a charm.  I am a little hesitant about eating it.  I love Cheddar's but will not be going back if they even look like they are busy.  While I was waiting there were servers talking about upset customers who had been seated, but not servered.  This is something that they should have discussed in the back.  When I spoke with one of the assistant manager she did apologize, but the damage was done.

text: Horrible  service our server's name was chandler!!!! She pocketed our ticket (we waited 45 minutes just to get our app plate of nachos that came our wrong)  then put it in for the wrong table number, one of the people from our party had to get up and basically her her own unsweet tea! The manager was lost as well and did not  know anything! We waited so long to get our food I had to ask for a to go box as soon as it came out! If you are in a rush I recommend not going to cheddars and the sad thing about it all is this was my favorite place to eat at! The kitchen tho... I do have to brag on everytime my steak and ribs are cooked to perfection!! Cheddars needs to work on the FOH employees before they lose a lot of business!!!!

text:
Nice people who cook good food. Tell them if want something different and they are helpful. I like to order my dishes without broccoli. I ask for extra veggies in my noodles. They are good about allowing substitutes. We did a take out for Mother's Day and they gave us plenty of food.

Good dine in or take out. Located in Flowl River on Dauphin Island Parkway.

resp.text: Hi Jude, thank you for being longtime friends of Oriental Palace.

name: Bob Brandt
text: Never disappointed 😊We had the good fortune to re-discover this location. They were just the BEST in Slidell,LA  21 years ago.

name: Taylor Snow
text:
We are here twice while in town. The restaurant dining room appears to be closed forever and this has been turned into carry out also. Our first experience we stopped in on our way home. The woman who I assume owns the pace helped us and could not have been nicer. Our food was delicious. However, all of that is overshadowed by our experience in attempting to order over the phone a week later. A man answered who I assume is her husband and he was extramural rude. I could not get a word in with him, constantly cutting me off and getting angry with me for trying to tell him our order. I ended up telling him he was being rude and that we would be taking our business elsewhere, he informed me he did not care. Pirates Pizza is highly recommend on the island. Go there instead.

I would eat here again, if I hear he is gone.

resp.text:
It's been tough for everybody since this pandemic. We've tried our best to remain open, with takeout only during this time.

Sorry your experience wasn't up to par. In this area, bad phone reception is common. And sometimes, we must take orders under very noisy kitchen environment, talking over loud equipment, exhaust fans, woks . . .

It happened to be so that day. Couldn't hear you at all the 1st call.

When we called back, it was still a spotty connection. We heard you wanted 102 (Palace Special Shrimp) with rice noodles. We tried explaining the 102 comes with white rice (or fried rice). It was frustrating because of the connection - something out of your control. If you heard our voice grew loud or shout-y, it was due to the environment, not our intentions. Then you said you changed your mind.

Again, sorry it came off as a less than happy experience! We hope you give us another chance, and our doors remain open to you in the meantime.

name: Natalie Taylor
text: Love this restaurant!  It's a standard go to when we are in the area.  Consistently great good, and the service is second to none.  It won't take long for you to see what I mean.  Give it a try, I guarantee you won't be disappointed!

resp.text: Natalie, thanks so much for taking the time to write this awesome review!

name: Asad Khan
text:
The food here is absolutely amazing... I stopped by for the first time tonight... Picked up a couple of entrees and am simply surprised how great the food is...

There is no dine in service currently.... I spoke to one of the owners of this establishment tonight too... She was pretty awesome and really described the cuisine well...

I honestly did not expect this quality of food down so South... I believe that this restaurant has been in operations since 2001 and now I understand why...

Orange chicken is awesome!!! I have found a gem...

resp.text: Hi Asad! Thanks so much for taking the time to write up this thoughtful, detailed feedback.

name: Josh Cooper
text: The food is consistently good.  The staff provides excellent service and is very pleasant to speak with as well!

resp.text: Glad you enjoyed our food! Looking forward to the next time you're in the area.

name: Jim Napier
text: It wasn't the worst Chinese I've ever had but it had room for some improvement. In a pinch I guess it would be okay

name: Rainy Day
text: It may not be my favorite place, but the food is cooked fresh and if eating in, the portions are definitely worth the price. It's a quiet little restaurant with children's art on the walls. It has a real family vibe. I haven't had a lot of things on the menu, but the egg rolls are really good.

resp.text: Glad to hear your feedback! Hope we can turn into your favorite place soon.

name: Donna Marie
text: Really good food, friendly service. I've been here a couple times now, they are always welcoming. The place is kept very clean. The food is good. I love that they can alter a dish to your preference, like taking the spice out or adding it.

name: Mj Brown
text:
Food was perfect. At 5 minutes til closing the owner welcomed us graciously and even chatted with us while we waited on our order.
Definitely  going back!

name: Mary Mareno (Petals)
text: Always good food, usually get takeout.  Generally ready 15 to 20 minutes.  Plenty to eat and good friendly people.

name: Celeste Holsombach
text: Best chinese food you can get! The owner and his family are always wonderful. We've been eating there since before I can remember and we'll keep eating there for as long as they're open!

resp.text: Hi Celeste! We always love seeing you and your whole family. Thank you so much for being longtime friends of Oriental Palace.

name: Mark Byrd
text: He makes all his own, from scratch. Wonderful experience. Always

resp.text: Thanks for telling us about your great experiences Mark, we take pride in making food from scratch. See you next time

text: Wonderful family restaurant. Food is excellent, restaurant is clean and the owners are absolutely lovely people!!! One of our favorite places to go.

resp.text: Hi Shelia, always glad to see old friends back. So happy to hear you had a great time with us. Hope to see y'all soon!

text: I love this place!!  Really sweet owners, and the food is excellent!  Every dish is made to order.  👍👍

resp.text: We are so happy to hear that you enjoy our dining experience Joanne! It is always a pleasure serving patrons like you.

name: Ryan Ransom
text: First time here stopped on the way back from visiting Fort Gains. Had the Orange chicken and shrimp rangoons. Food and service were excellent. It was fairly quiet being the off season and mid afternoon.

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! Hope to see you again if you around Dauphin island area.

name: Lenny Mayers
text:
It was a real treat to have such tasty Chinese food down here in Theodore. The chef and staff were very pleasant. The restaurant is very nice and the restroom was very clean. A very nice restaurant, indeed. Thank #You.
If I'm ever in the area.......
#Godspeed.

name: Comrade Salad
text:
Let me preface this by saying I have eaten at almost every Asian restaurant in the Theodore and Mobile area, so I've been around.

This place has the potential to be good, but it isn't it falls short. I ordered the General's Chicken and it came with Fried Rice and a Vegetable Roll. What I got was.... bad. I watched them microwave the food from my seat, so I already knew what was coming. The chicken has a strange after taste and tasted nothing like what you might expect it to taste like, and the Vegetable Roll was uneatable. Worst of all though was the Fried Rice. It was mushy, not at all fried and made to order and tasted like prepackaged rice.

If this place wants to become a great eating place it needs to wake up. COOK my food, don't reheat it. NOTHING is worse than Fried Rice that is just microwaved. Conversely, I LOVE fresh made rice and won't mind the wait.

Until they start actively making their food to order WHEN it is ordered I will not reccomend this place. Sorry.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for taking time out and giving us feedback! We're sorry your meal did not satisfy your expectations.

Our General Chicken is served fresh from the wok with our own recipe, and eggrolls here have always contained vegetables and shreds of pork.

True fried rice will naturally vary, and today's was on the soft side. We apologize that it didn't match your tastes. We always take good feedback to heart, and aim to improve next time!

name: Kim Thomason
text: Best wonton and egg drop soup.  The Saturday special was wonderful.  Best sweet and sour chicken I have had in 40 years. Will come back when in the area

resp.text: Thank you for dining with us, welcome back and have a happy and safe holiday !

name: Pamela Waleri
text: Food is always fresh. The eggrolls are very good. Very friendly owners. Clean & comfortable.

resp.text: So happy to hear this. We always pride ourselves on freshness. Thank you for the great review!

name: Tommy Harmon
text: Slow getting us our food. But was good when we got it

resp.text: Hi Tommy! Fresh good food takes time. You added on to your to-go while waiting. If you are in a hurry, ordering ahead is best.

name: Keith Morrison
text: I've been a customer of Oriental Palace since they opened 11 or 12 years ago. They are so friendly and accommodating. When we call for carry out they know who we are and our preferences. The food is simply fantastic and in all these years I have never, as in not once, received a dish that I was not pleased with.

name: Bill Schenk

name: Richard Brewer
text: Ignore the review by Aaron Wayman.  He doesn't know what he is talking about.  I live on Dauphin Island, and I have been going to this restaurant since they first opened about ten years ago.  The food is always excellent, and the owner and staff are always very pleasant.  Like most people, I have eaten at many different Chinese restaurants in my life, and I would place this one at the very top of my list.  Their prices are no different than other restaurants.  I have no idea how the other reviewer could have spent $55 dollars unless he was feeding his entire family.  Some people just like to have something to complain about.

text: It's decent, they need more business to increase quality and consistency of the food. Excellent place to eat lunch or dinner after a long day on the water.

text: Worst food I have ever eaten and I've had some really bad food before.  The eggrolls are loaded with tons of ginger.  The hot and sour soup was loaded with sugar.  Chicken was bland and rubbery and tasted like it was cooked in a microwave.  Vegetables were undercooked.  Fried rice was soggy and salty.  The food is way over priced.  I could have bought $55 dollars worth of dog food and had a better meal.  If you read this review please stay away unless you are preparing for fear factor.

resp.text:
Correct us if we're mistaken, but you seem to be Friday night's party of two who ordered Sweet & Sour Shrimp, and Sweet & Sour Chicken. It's too bad that we didn't meet your standards! But our waitress, Connie, did ask you how your dinner was a couple times. She mentioned you left us plates with only bits of chicken.

As to our Shrimp Rangoons, they are filled with cream cheese and beat shrimp. Our local patrons love this recipe!

Wish you could've told us about your opinions right away, so we could better serve you then!

Friendly staff.

text: Wow. Christmas day - it was busier & louder than I've ever seen it. There was a line at the door so my friend from high school & I opted for the counter.  JoJo barking out the orders with his loud & deep voice, the cooks fast-paced cooking, the waitresses taking turns waiting of people & washing dishes, and the gals cleaning tables.   They were really doing their stiff with a smile. All except that one guy - not management - who always seems to be walking around and not doing anything.  With all that going on, our food was hot, fresh, and tasty.

The food could have been better. The eggs were browned and not stirred/scrambled  good before cooking and the grits were barely warm. The service was very good.
Jun 10, 2021
The staff are great, the food is ok, but the dining room is ice cold!! My food gets cold before I can even eat it!!! Who wants cold eggs and hash browns?? This is a problem in almost ALL Waffle House restaurants.

name: Bill Eidson

name: Wanda Munguia
text: Would of have 5 stars if it wasn’t for our waitress Jess. She was very rude. Snatched silverware out of hand, didn’t check up on us after food was delivered, we had to flag her down just to get a coffee refill. Hair was all down in her face, and mask wasn’t worn right while she was inches from my face talking.  I’m a firm believer in tips but I tip based on service. No tip. Very unprofessional. If you hate your job just say that.

name: Amy Sims
text: It's sad when waffle House cannot take a to-go order over the phone they tell you to come down there and place your order on a recording.if I wanted to go down there and place my order I would eat in I want to call my order and go pick it up and go to my house and eat it so that's why you're getting a bad review.that's why you have no customers and when you close up and you don't have a job you'll learn to pick up that phone. So I'm taking my business to the next place that does calling orders for tonight so you lost my business for today

If your togo person gives a specific time it should be a team effort to get orders out.  Vs having 4 people looking at their to go orders while the same server gives other people their food. Purple haired Karen

We eat at waffle house (leeds, al) approx 5 times a week and will continue to do so, but grill master at this location (pell city) needs to work on making juicier sandwiches. name: Dale Mayer
text:
Waffle House is, of course, a southern staple...but it makes it even better when you have a server that is amazing.

We were on the road from Arkansas to Georgia and stopped here with our 3 kids for dinner. Our server, Tabetha, was an absolute delight. She was basically running half the restaurant by her self, yet still found time to show each table the attention they deserved. She was very helpful, and even spared some time for a kind word...all while running at LEAST 9 tickets!

Thanks again for making our visit easy and keeping us entertained and well-fed!

name: kevin daboin
text: Great service and great food!

name: Jerry Mays
text: Good food and friendly service

name: Kevin Thompson
text: This location is one of the best.  It is the same food as all the others, it's a chain.  What makes it different is the staff.  Great staff, they don't make you feel like you are bothering them, or that attitude of I wish you were somewhere else, you know what I mean.  Many locals eat here regularly, including me, so it can get very busy.  So far I have not had one of those super long waits here, they are pretty quick.  Stop by and give 'em a try.

text: I love Waffle House!!

name: Cyndi P
text: We had a short wait..but the Staff was on top of cleaning tables and seating us within 5 mins behind those leaving! Our Waitress, Ms Lisa, was awesome🙏 She was polite, cheerful and we always had hot coffee, creamer, jelly and refills on the kiddos drink...and all of this while having standing room only for those still coming in...OUR NEW FAVORITE PLACE...FOOD WAS DELICIOUS...TY!

name: Lillie Smith
text: Food was delicious! Got a happy HELLO when I walked in and the food was brought to me quickly. The waitress was careful to be sure I had everything I needed or wanted. WILL BE GOING BACK!

text: Went to waffle house last night and was grossed out by the cook he had is pants below his waist and his shirt was stuck in the crack of his butt. Asked for well done hash browns and got hash browns that looked like a piece of brown construction paper. When I told another server about it she told him and he said he should have spit in our food. Very gross.

Also, I was able to sit in comfort, I was not freezing while we ate.  Thank you Waffle House! Wish I could remember the waitresses name.  I will go back to this location.

text: Food was good and the staff was friendly and we went in at 1:00 a.m

name: Letha Cantrelle
text: This place is pitiful! My  husband  ordered a medium T-Bone steak and it was so overdone that it was close to cardboard! My nephew ordered a plain double-meat hamburger  with Bacon. Well the cook screwed up and put cheese on it and the waitress just told him to scrape the cheese off and I had to throw away the lertuce, tomato  and onions that was on it! I made them re-cook the burger and my child had to wait  for  almost 15 minutes  and watch us and his best friend eat while waiting! This is unacceptable.  My pork chops  were over-cooked as well! Best friend asked for a cheese burger with lettuce, tomato  and bacon and his burger had onions on it and had cubes of ham  on the side of his burger. Whatever that was for I don't know! Then charged me $40.81  for nearly the worst meal I have ever had at Waffle House!

text:
Good service. The waitress suggested a combination I would've never thought of. This one breakfast complete changed my view of the world. Suddenly, with one suggestion on how to add variety on my breakfast meal, I realized that the only limits to this world were the ones that I impose on myself; that my life is full of love and is fully open to me. I just have to put down false assumptions, pretenses, and prejudice. Walk into any situation with an open heart and mind.

Long wait deterred from overall experience.

name: Tom's World
text:
It's a waffle House in the South, if you've never been to one, try it. If you love steak, don't get one here.

You're welcome

name: Louise
text: Generally good food. The chili was cold when my husband got it. Sent it back to reheat and still wasn't as hot as you would like on a very cold day. The blt had plenty of bacon which was great. My Texas cheese melt was as good as usual and hash browns were as I ordered.

name: W and D

name: Kda Scorpio
text:
Currently nobody is behind the counter. Saw co-workers outside in the back area staring at me while me and another customer went inside, so I know they saw us come in. It has been 15 minutes now, and still ...nobody to help take the customer who walked in at the same time as me nor mines order. You have an obligation to work a certain job, we all do. If you can't do the job, and if you just don't want to do it, then don't do the job, don't even think about applying. It's not hard. Common sense. Manager should be seeing this and think about who she/he is hiring, and take precautions and action for moments like these. When this place (if it already hasn't) hits the hay one day, you will know and see why. Disrespectful.
(Update) waited 30 minutes. We both just left. wow..

text: It wasn't crowded at all. Only 2 people in there eating when we got there. Our waitress wasn't friendly, and didn't know her name, cause she didn't say. Our order was the only thing been cook and they messed it up. When I finally got my burger, I couldn't eat it. It was too overcooked and they discounted the check because I didn't have time for them to do another one, cause I had to be at work in an hour. I was waiting for more Tea and ended up just leaving without getting any more. Won't be back to this one for a while.

text: Don't expect gourmet food, but do expect decent food at an excellent price. You can also get in and out quickly. The staff is very friendly. It's a good choice for a filling breakfast while traveling. Not so good a choice for a first date.

name: marshae davis
text: This was the worst experience ever. I ordered the chicken melt and after taking 2 bites the chicken was rubbery tasting and whwn i asked the server to only charge me dor for my other  food she said because there wasnt a manager there she couldn't but i could call and explain to them. I wasn't about to do all that when it could have been handled at that moment. U could clearly see i didn't eat the sandwich and i didn't want them to remake it because i felt like all the chicken probably tasted that way especially since she blamed it on the way in which it was cooked. I just feel like some things r a simple fix and that was not handled properly.

name: Jan Hill
text: I guess Waffle House is popular in the south and although the food isn't bad, it wasn't the best and the staff that was there didn't appear to really need customers. I felt like I was intruding and no one was pleasant until we gave them a tip. This appeared to lighten their mood. The waitress was much nicer after that. It was a to go order so I don't think we made to much extra work for anyone. The people in the south are usually so nice and its the one thing I always look forward to. Las Vegas can be very self absorbed. I guess Waffle House also had it's moments.

name: Nicholas La Rosa
text: Great place to get breakfast all day long, 24/7. If you like breakfast type food this is the place to go. Fresh food cooked when you order it, not waiting in a window to be stuffed in a brown paper sack like a fast food joint.

name: Jonathon Chew
text: This might sound like too much praise. But the steak was excellent. I ordered it medium and after cutting into it there was just a hint of a pink line through the middle, which, by the way it is not easy to do on such a thin steak. This place is very well staffed as well. Best waffle house ever.

name: Jasmine Nicole

Five minutes went by and still no one acknowledged us and we actually heard the employees giggling in the back room so we just left smh..

We ordered sodas and we only got the originial drink, no refills, our drinks were finished before we got our meals and the waitress still wasnt bright enough to realize an empty glass needs to be refilled, after driving for 12 hours we just wanted to sit down to a meal. name: Rob and Christi Fondren
text: PLACES NOT TO EAT - Blue’s Diner in Phil Campbell, AL. My daughter was playing in a softball tournament and we came in for lunch. We arrived at 11:10 and were the first ones there. We ordered our drinks before the rest of her friends arrived. There were about 20 altogether. She ordered cheese sticks and a large BBQ sandwich. I ordered the small hamburger steak. Julia and the table next to us got their cheese sticks at the same time but within a minute, the server was back at our table to check her marinara sauce. She said, “it’s not good” and asked her if there was another sauce she would like. About 11:30, Julia got her sandwich as the rest of the food started coming out for the other tables. By 11:45, all of the people at the other tables had their food except one other person and myself. The mom at the table next to us told me that they found mold in their marinara which was why they took Julia’s sauce back. It had an “M” on it, which I now assume meant Monday. At 11:50, I asked our server “is my food almost ready because I have to leave in 5 minutes”. She went to the back and asked, came back out and said they were waiting on the fries. 2 minutes later, she brought me my food and I asked her if she could put it in a to-go box. I got up and went to the register to pay and had to ask for a fork. I thought surely they would give us our drinks for free or something, but nothing was offered except an apology. I paid $22 for the food and as I was waiting for the fork, another server asked ours why she apologized. She said, “because it took so long to get their food” and the other server said, “don’t...this is softball season and it is always like this”. I am a business owner myself and I rarely ever post negative reviews because I understand how things can go wrong and how many things are out of your control...and had this server not said this standing right there in front of me, I would not have posted this. Also, the cook explained to the people at the table next to us that it takes a while because everything is cooked homemade when ordered. However, my hamburger steak was definitely a pre-formed patty. And finally, my fries were still mostly raw when I finally got the chance to try to eat them at the ballpark. Save your money. Buy a salad at Piggly Wiggly or eat from the concession stand if you are playing a tournament in Phil Campbell.

name: Tina Andrews
text: The food was delicious. My husband and I ate for less than $20. He had a plate from the hot food bar. Fried chicken, fried okra and broccoli. We're not talking a small plate either. That was enough to feed two. The broccoli was to die for, the chicken was cooked to perfection crisp and juicy. No salt needed.  I had the Hogan Burger with fries and let me tell you that was one hell of a burger. Double patty, Double ham, and double bacon topped with FRESH lettuce, tomato and pickles. Less than $5 for all that juicy burgerness. As for the restaurant itsself it is small and inviting. The staff is super friendly and fun to talk to. It gives you the feeling of being in your grandma's kitchen. It is a bit hot in there but everything else makes up for it. Thank you for the great food and conversation. You got our business.

resp.text: Hello, we strive for excellence at Hogan's Diner and hate to have received our lowest ever review of only 2 stars from you. We hate if you did not find great satisfaction with our food or service. Is there any way that we can help you or make things better?

name: Brenda Morrison
text: Great food

name: Cornelia Thrash
text:
Boi did I have to work for this food! 3 times I ordered the fried fish and shrimp and 3 times they brought out a partial order! I must say, "They weren't even worth the wait! The only seasoning I could taste was the pepper. The onion rings were free due to the constant order mix-up. I'm glad cause if I had paid for them the level of disappointment would have been overwhelming. They are the low quality frozen onion rings that has the very thin supposedly sliced onion that has no onion flavor that's breaded in breading that has no flavor! I also ordered the crawfish that's boil-in-bag with potatoes,  sausage,  and corn. I imagine it would have tasted alright if I could have eaten it! There was so much grease in the bag and on the food I was afraid to try it! I don't know if the grease came from the cheap sausage that was included or if they added margarine thinking that would add flavor. The corn literally had to be rung out with paper towels before it was edible!
All-in-all the jewel in this experience was the waitress Ashanti! Her patience and her professionalism spoke volumes! Not once did she even sigh amidst the order mishaps. Thank you Ashanti! I only wish that all those who work in customer service had your attitude,  patience,  and humility!

resp.text:
Hi,Cornelia.
Thank you for your time to give us a feedback.

first of all,I’m glad you like Ashanti’s work! We’ll pass along the kind words.”

Secondly,I’m sorry your experience with us didn’t go well.

We use Conecuh original smoke sausage,I think it is pretty good quality and it’s local favorites.
And Our fried onion is one of our popular items ,that’s why we gave it on the house as we made a mistake on your foods. I’m sorry you didn’t like it.

Our seafood served in the bag,It’s kinda a trend in big cities like New York and Atlanta.I understand that some people not familiar with it,since it is different from local .

And also Our seafood boil is served with our house sauces,which contains butter,And they all taste great,It’s new and different from local ,but we have confidence that our seafood boil soon will become a favorite to the local.

name: Eric Richardson
text: We had fried oysters and calamari appetizers as well as steamed King crab and shrimp with corn, potatoes and sausage. The menu says steamed, which I usually equate with bland. Royals great seasonings and spices, however, make it more like the great boiled seafood South Louisiana is so famous for, and far from bland. We especially liked that Royal offers several different seasoning combinations levels as well as heat levels. It was all very fresh and delicious. Service was great -attentive but not bothersome. Very clean and spacious. I highly recommend Royal Seafood.

resp.text: We are grateful for your kind words and your time to leave us this amazing reviews,Thanks for sharing your review with us and the community.

name: Matt Simon
text: This is a hidden gem!! The food and service was great. If you are looking for great seafood, go here!!  Better than all the other places on Airport Blvd. (And better prices). We had a great mix of food and it was all great and cooked perfectly.

resp.text:
Thanks for leaving our business a 5-star rating, Matt. I’m glad that you had wonderful experience with us.

Your review,WAW! one of my favorites,it means a lot to our team,thank you so much,it’s truly appreciated!

name: Joshua Chancey
text: Service and food is amazing. Me and my kids loved the presentation of the steamed seafood bags on the platter as well as getting to wear the crab bibs. The butter seasoning sauce on the shrimp and crawfish is some of the best I've ever tasted. Will be back again soon!

resp.text:
Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us this amazing review.
Looking forward to seeing you soon

While It’s great you like our seafood flavor,I apologize for the cup and fork,it’s an uncommon instance,thank you for bring this to my attention,we will fix it right away and ensure this won’t happen again.
Looking forward to seeing you soon.

Hi,Joshua .thank you for your time to write us your opinion.

You are right that you can buy crawfish for half somewhere else.

Just so you know that our crawfish comes with corn,potato,and sausage.

Please take this for consideration... that price are not only food costs, but also labor costs, rent, taxes, insurance, maintenance and so on.

Our menu isn’t perfect for everyone,but everyone’s opinion is valuable to us. If necessary,we will optimize our menu to meet the most people’s needs.

Thank you!

text: In for a quick bite and was happy with the fast and efficient service.  We had no wait time and our Waitresses was fast and helpful to get out drinks and take our order. text: This place has it figured out! Great customer service, plenty of staff to accommodate everyone in a timely manner. Service with a smile, thank you Shani S ! The food...where do I start? Out of the box menu, portions are very large and taste great. The dessert bar is amazing! We will definitely be back!

name: Jurnee Moore
text: Hospitality was through the roof! There were so many food options, it was hard to decide what I truly wanted but I appreciate the options. Omelette hash browns  and waffle were amazing! It came out at a reasonable time and wasn’t that expensive either. I will definitely be back.

name: Connie Sparman
text: If your looking for a awesome place to go eat. They have awesome food and great service. I'm a very picky eater and they have some of the best tasting food. And you will have more than you can eat. The price is well worth it. The waitress was checking on us to see if we needed anything. And oh my goodness at the desert they have to choose from. Here you will get your money worth.

name: Jerry Martinez
text: City Cafe is the best diner in town. They have plenty of kinds of foods to choose from. Their cakes are so big they are giant. The prices are the excellent. All in all we go there at least once a week.

name: Michael Lombard
text: This place is a local treasure. Our food was excellent and the cake we had for dessert was some of the best I have ever had.

name: Tani
text: It’s such a gamble ordering takeout these days, but I was not disappointed. Cajun chicken salad and chicken noodle soup were pretty good.

name: Jessica Herndon
text: If I could give this place negative 100 stars I would. My order was completely wrong I had to ask for multiple missing items. The customer service was absolutely horrendous. The manager brought out what I was missing but then continued to barrage and insult me. The food was an absolute joke home fries are not fries there unseasoned boiled potatoes. The ham is a slice of cheap lunch meat. Good luck getting anything you ask for prices are out rageous for the cheap food they are serving. You will not get what you ordered and management will just barrage you blame you and over charge you. Never going back food was disgusting service was the worst I have ever had. Refused to correct much other than bringing out missing items.

name: Shannon O'Brien
text: Amazing value for the serving portions!!!  Professional and quick service.  I got the breakfast griddle.  Delicious!

name: Aimee Clemons
text: Went there for breakfast today. The food came out in a timely matter and our waitress stayed on top of things, she was very attentive and patient with this being our first time eating here. We hot big portions of food everything tasted good. My only complaint is that I wish there was a larger selection on the kids menu.

name: bigthinkstudio
text: Best breakfast, lunch or dinner with fast service, great food and good prices.  Dessert is  Off the Hook! Gotta try it!

name: Muhammad Keith
text: This place was recommended by a hotel staff member. I had the meat lovers omelette, with hash browns and a biscuit. I enjoyed everything. The waitress worked her butt off to keep all of her customers happy. Went back for lunch, and had the stuffed flounder, with crab meat, and Greek salad.

name: connie ward
text:
The food was good the service was good the place was clean. I highly recommend.

Oh i got the Greek salad.  Very good

name: Isamar Maldonado
text: The food here is awesome! Every time I come here, I order the seafood soup. The wings are full of flavor and wet just like I like them. The strawberry waffle is great as well. 100% recommend this place!

name: Heather Snavely
text:
DO NOT EAT HERE! After reading the reviews, we decided to try it out before heading home to Indiana. The food here is awful! We were sat as a table of 11 very quickly. It was busy so we weren't worried about having to wait to place our drink order. The chocolate milk was hand made and did not have enough chocolate in it. Then when we asked for more chocolate, our waitress took the glasses and added more chocolate. It became almost undrinkable! The sweet tea was delicious however.
We ordered a mixture of breakfast foods and lunch foods. The only thing edible were the french fries. The bacon was hardly cooked, the biscuits and gravy were dry and chalky, and the hash browns tasted like cardboard. The bread on the club sandwich was hard. The kids chicken tenders looked great but tasted very dry. The french toast was yellow and tasted like a normal piece of potato bread. Our waitress brought a small container of syrup for the entire table. We left more food on the table than we ate.

name: Rebecca Ricks
text: The food was absolutley fabulous. They also have a dessert case full of yummy desserts. We enjoyed the lemon cake and key lime pie. We will definitely be back. The people were all really friendly.

name: Wayne Clark
text: Very good place to eat: breakfast , lunch or dinner any time during the day you wish!! A large menu with a vast variety. Great service with personality. Cannot go wrong!

name: Robert Whitehead
text:
The food here is good, if not spectacular, and the portion sizes will ensure that you won't walk away hungry. It's one of the few places in town where you can get matzo ball soup, and the chopped steak and eggs breakfast is surprisingly tasty.

There are several good Greek dishes that come with lemon potatoes; these are particular favorites of mine, especially the gyros.

The desserts are fabulous, and the refrigerated case just inside the front door ensures that you will see them. You can order one of the cakes (which stand about six inches tall) for a special occasion, but they need about two weeks lead time.

name: M Webster
text: Their desserts are absolutely decadent! Service was good. My veggie pita lacked flavor. Everything I ordered was drowned and dripping in oil! (Veggie pita, lemon potatoes and stuffed grape leaves). It would be nice to have a few more plant based options.

name: Kyle Gott
text:
Bruhhh, this place is the bomb. If you’re looking for somewhere to eat, just come here. They have over 400 items on the menu so you definitely find something that you want.

We’ve been here 4 or 5 times and it’s always been incredible and the servers have always been awesome, friendly, and the extremely attentive. The country fried steak with mashed potatoes is amazing.

name: Tani
text: It’s such a gamble ordering takeout these days, but I was not disappointed. Cajun chicken salad and chicken noodle soup were pretty good.

name: Marty Thomas
text: Great selection of food choices. Meals were very good in our group of 12. Restaurant could use updating a bit. Desert is a 10, you must try the cakes

name: Ro Ro
text: 12/24/2020  Although most restaurants seem to close early, City Cafe Diner is usually open.  Huge food portions and great menu selection.  I don't know how many Diners are operating in Huntsville, but this is our favorite late night Diner.

name: Irma Osorio
text: Our waitress Amy was so welcoming and attentive throughout our meal. She kept our coffee topped off and checked in on us despite being fairly busy. My eggs and bacon were prepared just like I ordered. I couldn't finish my breakfast- so I was able to take the rest home and will get to enjoy another good meal.

name: Wade's World
text: The City Cafe is a great place to grab a great meal and we brag on it! A great variety of items and awesome cheese cakes and desserts. I would compare the cheesecakes to the famous Cheesecake Factory. Great service and great food a must if you're in the area and well worth telling your friends about!

name: Michael Lombard
text: This place is a local treasure. Our food was excellent and the cake we had for dessert was some of the best I have ever had.

name: George Mann
text: I got the twin cheeseburgers and fries with sweet tea to drink. Very large portion of food. Well prepared and very tasty too. If you've never tried them before I would recommend giving them a try. It was very good. Friendly wait staff. Clean environment.

name: Rae M
text: The french toast was literally just two slices of yellow bread. No eggs. No butter. Asked for strawberry preserves and just got some old strawberries. Really disappointed. Bleh.

name: Brittany Irwin
text: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner all of it is amazing!!! The staff are awesome!! The wait, there hasn’t been any the 3 times my husband and I been. We choose them over Cracker Barrel... which is how we found them!! Cracker Barrel had a 45 minute wait. Right next door is the place. They even have cakes, they are fabulous as well!!!!

name: Honda's and Music (Crazy Eddie)
text: Work right down the road from them.... Go to lunch there at least once a week... And often go with family. Prices are good and they have a lot to choose from.

name: Chris Chapman
text: Food 🥑 s always good and service 🐕‍🦺 s always good. I try to order something different everytime because the menus is so big and so far everything is always really good. I would recommend this place.

name: DogBar Dave
text: Lots of tastey cafe food. Good value. Big portions.  And be sure to linger over the beautiful outrageous cakes on the way out. Big slices!

name: Phil Jones
text: Food was great, service was friendly, spot on accurate and quick. Prices are as good as the food. Menu offers large number of options, when you walk in there is a dessert case that ensures a return visit. I tried the Mexican Omelette, good choice if you like spicy.

name: Antonio Billups
text:
The staff was very friendly and helpful the place has a nice welcoming environment and nice local old school diner vibe.

I order the Gyro definitely not getting the lamb taste idk just didn’t taste like all the other gyros or lamb I will definitely be back but just get something else the food was hot and came out fairly quickly

name: Bailey
text:
An outrageously large menu means nothing is really specialized and therefore nothing REALLY stands out as wonderful.  Breakfast dishes and desserts are usually safe, though. It's not the cleanest place, nor does it have the fastest service, but it's open late, a sit down place, and pretty crowd friendly, so it's a cool change of pace from Waffle House and McDonald's and the like.

My most recent visit, I got the chicken piccata, which was a mistake.  over-sauced, overcooked noodles, lemon flavor was too strong, and greasy, mushy chicken.  I couldn't even eat half of it.  Stick with breakfast items and dessert if you visit.

name: Freda Gaines
text: I'll eat at home from now own ! Food warm not Hot. Fried potatoes, last night's eft over . Lol

name: Holley Jett
text: Love this place...one of my absolute favorite places to eat in Madison County.

name: Ken Priest
text:
Ambiance was good. Service good. Restaurant clean. Food stuck on the bottom of the plate. Bread and garlic butter good. Mushroom soup very good.
I also ordered a ruebin sandwich expecting New York deli style. Sandwich was dry, no sauce.  Not the kind of bread I expected. Not a dark bread. Sandwich was not grilled in butter. Not at all what I expected.

name: Irma Osorio
text: Our waitress Amy was so welcoming and attentive throughout our meal. She kept our coffee topped off and checked in on us despite being fairly busy. My eggs and bacon were prepared just like I ordered. I couldn't finish my breakfast- so I was able to take the rest home and will get to enjoy another good meal.

name: Teresa Roberts
text: As always....DELICIOUS!!! AWESOME SERVICE!!

name: George Mann
text: I got the twin cheeseburgers and fries with sweet tea to drink. Very large portion of food. Well prepared and very tasty too. If you've never tried them before I would recommend giving them a try. It was very good. Friendly wait staff. Clean environment.

name: Brittany Irwin
text: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner all of it is amazing!!! The staff are awesome!! The wait, there hasn’t been any the 3 times my husband and I been. We choose them over Cracker Barrel... which is how we found them!! Cracker Barrel had a 45 minute wait. Right next door is the place. They even have cakes, they are fabulous as well!!!!

name: Rae M
text: The french toast was literally just two slices of yellow bread. No eggs. No butter. Asked for strawberry preserves and just got some old strawberries. Really disappointed. Bleh.

name: Johnny Jones
text: Great atmosphere, people and food.  I will be coming back.

name: Fred Atkinson
text: Great food and service! Huge portions. You will not leave hungry!

name: JOHN MANN
text:
City Cafe Diner is part of a small chain of family-owned restaurants, including the Marietta Diner, featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. Very clean, attractive facility. They are famous for BIG cakes and other bakery good: pies, baklava, cookies and cheesecakes.
Neat, friendly servers-everyone was observing the current requirements
Menu: The menu offers fewer choices than I remember from previous visits; I suspect that is due to the current situation. I also remember (maybe incorrectly) that breakfast was served all day. That is no longer true.
The Food. Coffee was hot and good; servers were always ready with a refill,. Big plus: coffee is included with the price of breakfast! The toast and grits were good (any bread other than toast incurs an extra charge). My Western Omelette left a little to be desired (thus the degradation of rating to 4 stars).  It was a "3-egg omelette", but they must have been SMALL eggs.. The fillings (the normal Western Omelette ham, green peppers, onions) were good and tasty.  The extra $1+ charge to include cheese was not expected. Also, unexpected: the omelette was quite overcooked. No "fluffy" omelette here. It was not bad enough to return to the kitchen, but it was not a great experience, with dry, almost rubbery eggs. Definitely was not up to par with other City Cafe experiences (at their various locations). One plus: they put only strawberry and grape jellies on the table-you don't have to dig through a dozed "mixed fruit" packets to find the lone strawberry jam!
I still recommend City Cafe Diner but with some minor reservations at this time.

resp.text: Hi John thank you for your visit and your comments.  We strive to do our best daily and will continue to do so and hope your next experience with us will be even better.  Also we do serve breakfast ALL day from 7am to 10pm.

name: Honda's and Music (Crazy Eddie)
text: Work right down the road from them.... Go to lunch there at least once a week... And often go with family. Prices are good and they have a lot to choose from.

name: Chris Chapman
text: Food 🥑 s always good and service 🐕‍🦺 s always good. I try to order something different everytime because the menus is so big and so far everything is always really good. I would recommend this place.

name: DogBar Dave
text: Lots of tastey cafe food. Good value. Big portions.  And be sure to linger over the beautiful outrageous cakes on the way out. Big slices!

name: Akita King
text: Awesome food!! Great service.

name: Bailey
text:
An outrageously large menu means nothing is really specialized and therefore nothing REALLY stands out as wonderful.  Breakfast dishes and desserts are usually safe, though. It's not the cleanest place, nor does it have the fastest service, but it's open late, a sit down place, and pretty crowd friendly, so it's a cool change of pace from Waffle House and McDonald's and the like.

text:

I order the Gyro definitely not getting the lamb taste idk just didn’t taste like all the other gyros or lamb I will definitely be back but just get something else the food was hot and came out fairly quickly

name: Ken Priest
text:
Ambiance was good. Service good. Restaurant clean. Food stuck on the bottom of the plate. Bread and garlic butter good. Mushroom soup very good.
I also ordered a ruebin sandwich expecting New York deli style. Sandwich was dry, no sauce.  Not the kind of bread I expected. Not a dark bread. Sandwich was not grilled in butter. Not at all what I expected.

name: Stephanie Vasse
text:
WILD portion sizes, too much for me to eat in one sitting for sure. I loved the free feta cheese spread they offer in the beginning. My chicken salad melt was good, though the cheese wasn't exactly melted when it got to me. Good bread and chicken salad.

The highlight was the ridiculous piece of blondie cake I shared. We could barely eat half of the narrower end between the two of us. I took it home and the leftovers fed five with small slices! The cake was delicious, full of flavors and varying textures between layers. I would go back just for cake.

name: Cape Driver
text: What an amazing place! Greek diners are one of my favorite places to eat and this one ranks very high in my opinion. Many menu choices with something for all

name: Shirley Hall
text: very good and cheap!!  great for a big group. we had 7 people, server was GREAT, food came out just the way we asked!!

name: Judy Kim
text: These are the nicest people. The menu is extensive (and that's an understatement). You can get breakfast here all day. They are known for their desserts. I love their omelettes, but I recently had some kind of breakfast special that had 3 eggs, pancakes, sausage and bacon. Plenty of food for 2.

name: Dewayne Dupree
text: The food was amazing I would give it 10 stars if possible, highly recommended it. Waitresses very friendly if you haven't tried it you are missing out on a lot. Never heard of this place before they really should advertise more. Just happened up on it.

name: Fran Roberts
text: The food was amazing and the waiter was amazing. He made my husband and my Valentine's day. A little more amazing. And a little more special.

name: Taltos Hicks (Tala)
text: Decent food, great variety of you don't know what you want.

name: Fred Atkinson
text: Great food and service! Huge portions. You will not leave hungry!

name: Renae Harris
text: A bit pricey, but understandable, giving the circumstances 😌. Very polite and respectful employees. What really caught my eyes were the Cakes. OMG, they were so beautiful and huge🥰! They were decorated perfect, like something out of a Martha Stewart book, looking tasty 😋.. I also think dat u can order lunch in the morning 👍..I enjoyed my lil time there😁

name: Ginger Hammonds
text: Very suprised with this great cafe!! Huge portions, attentive staff, fantastic extensive menu, breakfast, lunch and dinner served anytime of the day.  They even offered a special menu with dessert.  Definitely give it a try!

name: Fred Trevino
text: The food is incomparable, the wait staff uniquely &sincerely friendly. City Cafe is my 'git to' restaurant. A 5 Star rating!

name: D Isbell
text: I took my son there for Valentine's breakfast and we were very pleased with the food, service and atmosphere. I didn't realize they cook peppers and onion in their home fries, which I don't eat, so the waitress was nice enough to trade them out for hash browns. I bought a slice of cake and pie which I thought were overpriced until I saw the size of them! I will definately go back again

name: Tressie Dean
text: Good pastrami sandwiches. Fries are tasty. Sandwich is just meat and bread, and the slices are really thick (prefer mine shaved.) Maybe need a Reuben next time.

name: Sherry Dalton
text: The food was excellent and the service was great. This was my first visit, but I will definitely be going back.

name: Johnny Jones
text: Great atmosphere, people and food.  I will be coming back.

name: Tony O
text: Biggest menu I’ve ever seen in a local cafe. It’s good!

name: Boom 192
text:
Wow.  What can I say about this place?  They are so hospitable.  From the time I sat down until the time I left they were bringing me food and drink.  The food is delicious and plentiful and the staff is attentive and wonderful.

If you leave hungry you did something wrong.

One of the best restaurants I have ever been to in my entire life.

I literally love this place.

name: Johnny Davis
text: Delicious food great service and big cakes. Worth the time go see them

name: Jacob Calvert
text: The "Zorba the Greek" is great, and the spanakopita is delicious. Prepare yourself to take some to-go as the portions are generous.

name: D Robinson
text: This place is amazing, food is oh so good with large portions and you must check out the cake and pie area is WOW! So Hard to choose what to eat since they have such a variety of different types of foods.  Go and BE HUNGRY!

name: Stephanie Vasse
text:

The cake was delicious, full of flavors and varying textures between layers. I would go back just for cake.

name: Stella Curbow
text:
Great food. Looks like a small place but you'll be surprised
Great pancakes

name: Blessed Mommies
text: Great food manager was awesome, the girl at register was awesome. Highly recommended.

name: Drake Hodges
text: This place is quickly becoming one of my favorite places to eat in Huntsville. Giant menu with quality food and service. Oh, and the desserts are incredible.

name: Stephen Waring
text: Wide selection, big helpings, excellent service. Terrific Greek selections.

name: Wanda Starr-Ferguson
text: Food is always good and prices are just right...Wendy our server was great! Will be back. .

name: Naomi Hooper
text: Wow food and service was wonderful !

name: April Sayre
text: Great variety of food from american to greek and more .great place to eat!!!

name: Susan Tausch
text: Always one of my favorite Huntsville spots to dine. Extensive menu and daily specials.  Everything I've had is fabulous and the beautiful cakes they have taste just as amazing as they look!!!  Never have been disappointed by service of quality of food.

name: Valerie Daniel
text: The cakes are great! Not worth 8 bucks for a piece of pie tho

name: Bob Burns
text: Not sure why the Ruben sandwich has been difficult to find over the last year...but if you want a great Ruben in the Huntsville area go to the City Cafe Diner...served with 2 onion rings, a mess of fries and a pickle spear.  I will be back...

name: Samuel Hunt
text: Went in for dinner after church about 7:30 pm. Excellent food. Excellent service. The chopped steak was a very large plate and great value. The red velvet cake was a great finish. Michael is a great night mr and donna was a terrific server. Thank you for a great evening. UPDATE. Tried breakfast 2 days later. The food was not good at all. The hashbrowns were smashed thinner than a pancake and burnt to a crispy. It ruined my expectations. Advice: go for dinner during Michael shift. 👌

name: Glenda Cody
text: Love this place eat supper every Friday night they. Love the people nice and friendly.

name: Arthur Morris
text: The service was great!! The pancakes were just okay (to me).

name: Ez canalla
text:
Great service and food.
Quick response kitchen 👌
The waitress (Amy) was also friendly

name: Ashley Bazinet
text: We love city cafe, it is our favorite place! Sometimes we come across some wonderful servers also and tonight Tonya was the definition of a wonderful server. Her postive, playful attitude made our dinner that much more enjoyable. She was also very attentive to my husband's ridiculous refills. Tonya has been our server the past 2 times and we will keep coming back just to see her! She's an asset to this company. Thank you Tonya!!!

name: Christa Whitman
text: The food as well as the staff are great!! The portion sizes are huge and well worth the money.

name: George Preussel
text: Great food.  Exceptional price, make sure you get a slice of cake they are huge!

name: Joseph Drury
text:
I go here relatively often. Each time I have gone I see the same people and they always seem happy to be there. The dining area is always clean and I have always been greeted promplty and politely.
The food here is fantastic. I get the gyros and other Greek dishes all the time with my family. Some of the best Greek food I have had: crispy foods are crisp, soft foods are soft, never too greasy, never tastes frozen or old.
The cakes are amazing. If you order a 'slice' of cake here, its basically a full cake worth on your plate. All of the cakes, pies, and cheesecakes are great and vary in sweetness.
I posted a picture of my favorite meal. Cant remember the name but its a Greek dish. They ran out of lemon potatoes this time (which are fantastic) but gave me some delicious fries instead.

name: Taylor Miller
text: Great all around menu and delicious desserts,highly recommended

name: Justin Johnson
text: Kinda expensive for what you get, food kinda bland,  waitress not very friendly. I don't reccomend.

name: Akita King
text: Awesome food!! Great service.

name: Julie's Life Journey
text: The best salmon!  The best service.

name: cvm 1
text: Awesome food and excellent service. A real gem

name: Patti Golden
text: Food was delicious!! Service great, too.

name: Roger Blansfield
text: Food and service was great as usual have never been disappointed in meals at city cafe.

name: Lorraine Patterson
text: Great food, lots of choices. Very generous portions. Inside and outside seating.

name: Cameron Grisham
text: Always good and reasonably priced. Love the atmosphere.

name: Sherl Dantzler
text:
We had Breakfast service was good...food was good..Staff seems to be well train Durning this pandemic time
We felt comfortable eating their

name: SoulReaver 716
text: Nice place & good food. Customizable meals & an "all day" menu.

name: Gayle Ochs
text: We love the Cafe City diner! You can have breakfast lunch or dinner anytime of the day. The food is excellent quality! The desserts are mile high cakes to baklava! And if you have ever eaten real baklava this is it! You can even have your dessert before your meal here. All the staff are friendly and good at their job. On The menu you will find everything from steak, pasta, fish or chicken.

name: Jean Seibert
text: Great Food , Great service. Large menu to choose from. We enjoyed. Making it out place, to enjoy.

name: Sandra Shertzer
text: Everything was delicious! Will be back! Loved it!

name: Craig Cogburn
text: The food was delicious..service was great...very large portions..I'll go back...

name: Rachelle Griffin
text: As I read some of these reviews I’m guessing I must have ordered the wrong thing I ordered the gyro and grape leaves the meat in the gyro wasn’t good at all you know a gyro has really this shaved lamb meat this meat was thick and kinda gamey it wasn’t good I took the meat out and just ate the pita bread the grape leaves were old and kinda hard the warm bread she brought out was good the fries were good the tea was good that’s about it and I did tell her it wasn’t good and she did offer to replace it but you know I just said it’s fine maybe should have stuck to breakfast 😬

name: Thomas Mahler
text: If you are a fan of old school, large menu, northern style dinners, this is the place to go in Huntsville. The menu is huge. An extensive breakfast menu is available anytime. There are many Greek and Italian items for lunch and dinner as well as many American favorites. I had the Greek combo for lunch - a huge gyro, Greek style lasagna, and potato wedges painted with an great sauce. It was huge and delicious. Don't overlook the soups, particularly the chicken noodle. Also, there are the traditional glass cases filled with amazing deserts.

name: Heather Moore
text: Food was great as always but the service was mediocre.

name: Allison McCormick
text: Good place to eat in. Takeout leaves a lot to be desired.

name: Lori Parker
text: Food was good. Service was fast and everyone was friendly. Kinda pricey...just a warning

name: Craig Noneman
text: When you just want big portions of decent food, this is a good place to go. The breakfast is decent, the Greek food is pretty good, and the cake slices are humongous. Good place to get a cup of coffee and diner food. It isn't a gourmet restaurant, but it's good simple food. The staff is always friendly and helpful.

name: Tammy W.
text: I always wanted to eat here every time I come home. I must say I am not disappointed at all. The food is delicious and was served hot. They give you a lot of food to. The customer service is awesome! This is now my favorite restaurant in Huntsville. It's a must I eat here now.

name: mark mitchell
text: Unreal menu   great selection.  Unbelievable deserts

name: Melody Byrd
text: Dessert is da bomb, food is so so

name: Lee Meeks
text:
Enormous portions, reasonable prices, and the friendliest wait staff you'll find around! I'm particularly fond of their lunch specials, which will run you about $10-$13 before tip (with water) and give you enough food to have for lunch the next day. The menu is extensive and I've heard that to be a read flag for other places. Not so with CCD as I've never been disappointed from country fare like biscuits and gravy to their fajita plate. They specialize in Greek food and it shows through their various "tour" Greek platters. Better gyros than the dedicated Greek places in town, too! They also have fantastic cakes that are always fresh and moist and absolutely gigantic! Myself and 2 other large guys had trouble finishing a single $8 slice after finishing about half of our dinners.
By far my favorite place to eat in Huntsville!

name: Jordan Roman
text: Had a very good breakfast there.  Fast service.

name: Craig Cogburn
text: The food was delicious..service was great...very large portions..I'll go back...

name: Sandra Shertzer
text: Everything was delicious! Will be back! Loved it!

name: Allison McCormick
text: Good place to eat in. Takeout leaves a lot to be desired.

name: Dawn Cangelosi
text: Great people, wonderful service.  Food is always great.  They have Aron of options and it is always a joy!

name: Jordan Roman
text: Had a very good breakfast there.  Fast service.

name: Josh Roberts
text: I remarked that they could open a sister location and call it Country Cafeteria Delicatessen to my companion Eric R1 Johnson as he furiously scribbled outside the lines on the kids menu. This wouldn't have been bothersome except for his inability to keep his tongue in his mouth when coloring.  I ordered three pancakes and they arrived quickly and were absolutely delicious. Much like Royal Rose this is also a 'New York Diner' style establishment. The service is great, the portions are large and you walk past a cooler case loaded with a lethal amount of deviously divine desserts on your way to a booth.

name: mark mitchell
text: Unreal menu   great selection.  Unbelievable deserts

name: Sean Cohen
text: We have been going here since they opened and I have to say that this is probably the first time I have actually been disappointed in a meal that we had there.  I am used to the thick , delicious challah bread french toast that they usually serve and what I got was two thin slices of what looked like store bought white bread.  The bacon was so crispy that if you looked at it wrong it would crumble into tiny pieces.  In 35 plus minutes I think I was only able to get one refill on my coffee.  Something was just off about this time.  I won't completely hold this trip against City Cafe because of all of the rest of our trips but something was definitely off.

name: Devonna Powell
text: I ored the fried chicken which comes with mashed potatoes and gravy and green beans. Potatoes were excellent, chicken had no season and was bland, green beans really mushy. My husband ordered a burger from adult menu while my child ordered one from the kid menu. The burgers were the same size. If anything, my child's burger looked bigger. And both came with a side of fries. It looked like we ordered 2 adult plates. My husband said the burger had no flavor, but my child liked theirs. I was overall not impressed with the food. For the price, I expected superb tasting food. Most of the items were just bland and tasteless. However, like I said, the mashed potatoes were on point and the fries were excellent as well. I will also say portion sizes are huge

name: Lucky-Cloud 78
text: The food was delicious and very abundant.   The service was especially  nice and prompt.  The atmosphere was fun and friendly.  We will  definitely be back and become regulars!!

name: Kristian Starlin
text: This place is amazing! I have NEVER gotten anything that we don't like. The portions are HUGE and the people that are there treat you like family.  If I could give 10 stars,  I would!

name: Melody Byrd
text: Dessert is da bomb, food is so so

name: Greg Byrd
text: Great place to eat in huntsville.

name: Shawn Cezanne
text: Awesome experience. Delicious food! Excellent service! Nice atmosphere! Incredible desserts! Can't wait to go back here.

name: Flump
text: Ive been there only twice, but everything was perfect both times! Usually with such an extensive menu, restaurants can’t keep the standard high with every meal. That was surprisingly not the case. The portions were huge!! And everything came out nice and fresh. The servers both times were nice and got our orders 100% right. I never expected this place to amount to much but i will call this place a new favorite!!

name: justinaday33
text: My family visited on 03/21/21.Food was decent. Will not visit again.

name: OLGA ALVAREZ
text: This place is amazing!!! The pork chops are the best..love it!! My waiter Marta did a really good job. We are definitely coming back to this restaurant!

name: David Adair
text: Always great food and great service. We never leave hungry!

name: Many Rainbows
text: My food was fine, though i had to wait a long time for the tzatziki sauce for my gyro. My older son's ruben sandwich was very bland tasting, as if it had no sauce on it, and my husband's biscuits were hatd as a rock. Not enoigh people working for how busy it was, so 3 of 4 people at the table had empty drink glasses less than halfway through our meal.

name: Max Fequiere
text: Honestly. It was mediocre. It had the potential to be great but it wasn't. Large amounts of food being Shipped out the kitchen at too fast a pace will spell for mistakes.....and there was plenty with me and my friends dishes

name: Crystal Swaim
text: The food was GREAT! It was just very noisy.

name: George Perez
text: Friendly awesome service, food always tasty.

name: Josh Roberts
text: I remarked that they could open a sister location and call it Country Cafeteria Delicatessen to my companion Eric R1 Johnson as he furiously scribbled outside the lines on the kids menu. This wouldn't have been bothersome except for his inability to keep his tongue in his mouth when coloring.  I ordered three pancakes and they arrived quickly and were absolutely delicious. Much like Royal Rose this is also a 'New York Diner' style establishment. The service is great, the portions are large and you walk past a cooler case loaded with a lethal amount of deviously divine desserts on your way to a booth.

name: Andy Fuller
text: Great food. Service good. Very groovy music which gives you an urge to dance. I Also think you should add some crumpets to your menu and everyone likes a good crumpets.

name: JOHN MANN
text:
City Cafe Diner is part of a small chain of family-owned restaurants, including the Marietta Diner, featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. Very clean, attractive facility. They are famous for BIG cakes and other bakery good: pies, baklava, cookies and cheesecakes.
Neat, friendly servers-everyone was observing the current requirements
Menu: The menu offers fewer choices than I remember from previous visits; I suspect that is due to the current situation. I also remember (maybe incorrectly) that breakfast was served all day. That is no longer true.
The Food. Coffee was hot and good; servers were always ready with a refill,. Big plus: coffee is included with the price of breakfast! The toast and grits were good (any bread other than toast incurs an extra charge). My Western Omelette left a little to be desired (thus the degradation of rating to 4 stars).  It was a "3-egg omelette", but they must have been SMALL eggs.. The fillings (the normal Western Omelette ham, green peppers, onions) were good and tasty.  The extra $1+ charge to include cheese was not expected. Also, unexpected: the omelette was quite overcooked. No "fluffy" omelette here. It was not bad enough to return to the kitchen, but it was not a great experience, with dry, almost rubbery eggs. Definitely was not up to par with other City Cafe experiences (at their various locations). One plus: they put only strawberry and grape jellies on the table-you don't have to dig through a dozed "mixed fruit" packets to find the lone strawberry jam!
I still recommend City Cafe Diner but with some minor reservations at this time.

resp.text: Hi John thank you for your visit and your comments.  We strive to do our best daily and will continue to do so and hope your next experience with us will be even better.  Also we do serve breakfast ALL day from 7am to 10pm.

name: Ernie Manning
text: Nice staff, excellent menu variety and great service.

name: Adara vaughn
text: Absolutely love the food here, large portions for a great price. We can never order just one thing bc it’s all so good. But also the staff is unbelievably accommodating and helpful. We even use it a celebration restaurant bc we love it all so much. Thank you City cafe for being a staple in our lives ❤️

name: Michael Turner
text: Definitely go there hungry! The servings are massive. I had the Athens combo and it was delicious. The Greek salad was very fresh and bursted with flavor. The lemon potatoes was seasoned and cooked perfectly. The Moousaka tastes authentic and is as close as you can get to being in Greece. The spanikopita is large and baked to a wonderful golden brown. The service was exceptionally awesome. The atmosphere is exactly what you would picture as a 50s diner. Now for the cake, there are too many options to list, but the cake is a must have!!

name: Mark Toland
text: Good food. Good service. Friendly staff. Large assortment of desserts. Recommend when you can't decide what to eat. Wide variety of options so everyone can get what they want.

name: Camille&Ben Richardson
text: Everything was wonderful I'm glad they were open on Christmas Eve we appreciated all the little extras and the food was great atmosphere was wonderful that was our first time and we will go back

name: Donnarene Brooks
text: Great service! Short wait time!

name: Lisa Wiley
text: Food was great!  A little pricey, but good.

name: Pamela Graves
text: Great service and food. Best place to have Breakfast..Belgium Waffles are awesome use fresh strawberries 🍓

name: Carol Holmes
text: best gyros I have had since I was 19 in Chicago. My new favorite place to eat in Huntsville.

name: Donald Baucom
text: A good variety of menu items. Portions a large.   Dessert choices are good if you are still hungry.

name: M Hartmann
text: Liked the gluten free/vegetarian guide. It really simplified meal selection. The food was very good and service was prompt.

name: Melissa Hutchens
text: Food was delish and Cheese Cake was out of this world

name: Harry Hall
text: We considered our experience at City was quite pleasant. We were there for breakfast but passing by all of the desserts most certainly turned our heads. Be back for dinner soon!

name: Rick Nickel
text: I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and it was good but the meatballs had a lot of gristle in it.

name: Jeremy Williams
text: Tonya was a great sever. Brought a great mood to our table. Very professional! The meals are always great! Thank y'all!

name: Renee Clayton
text: They always have such great food and the servers are friendly!You won't go home hungry.

name: Morgan Sample
text: Food is always PHENOMENAL! Service is always warm & friendly.  Cakes are to Die for!!!! 🎂🎂🎂🎂🎂Yummy

name: C A
text:
Loved it as always!
Great staff, management and cooks.
The atmosphere is relaxed even in this difficult time.
....get a slice of cake from here if you are reading this and you can thank them for me too.
Enjoyed the REAL Breakfast food that is getting harder and harder to find now days.

name: Linda G
text: The best place in Huntsville to eat.  The biggest piece of cake for $7.95......incredible.  So many choices on the menu, you won't know where to start.   Try it once......you will love it.

name: Donna Seay
text: Always delicious! Especially on Thanksgiving. So many homemade cakes and pies too!

name: Ian Swepston
text:
The wait staff here is so beyond excellent. I come here for breakfast every other week and the table is already set when we get there.

Food is always good and very reasonable prices. Coffee surprisingly good. Exactly what I want from a diner.

name: Mike Lenox
text: Wonderful food - awesome cheesecake - and good service!

name: Serena you
text:
This place is always pretty busy, a huge menu, if you know what to order it's great, if not then stick to what the locals ate eating, to many cats spoil the broth as they say lol
The cake selection,  now thats a different story yum!!!
But my hotdog was standard cold blah!

name: Anthony Leach
text: I like the food, but the cakes and pies are too good to be true. Trust me! 👍

name: Joshua Groce
text: Great Food at Great Prices, with Great Service!

name: Annetha Smith
text: They have a spinach pie that I love and also great Greek food

name: Baby Roy
text: Great desserts, breakfast, and... well... food! I really like the classic cheesecake and the Alabama burger. My daughter loves coming here for dessert! All of the servings are quite large! Very good diner. They have one of the largest menus in town. Always enjoy dessert... Especially the key lime cheesecake.

name: Bobby Hodge
text: Great place to eat with lots of variety to choose from.

name: Ana Childress
text: The food is super delicious and very filling!

name: BadToTheBone116 994
text: Very good food yes

name: Rachel Hope
text: Good food and nice waitress

name: Beth Christa
text: Disgusting and a waste of money. Everything we got was congealed in some way. The greek chicken lemon soup was like warm and DISGUSTING. The chicken fettuccine alfredo was obviously microwaved with butter grease all in the bottom, chicken was rubber, and the sauce taste sour. You'd get better for at a school cafeteria honestly.

name: Matt Stephens
text: Always good food and huge selection.

name: G Thompson
text: Good food. Great service. You never leave hungry.

name: Lee Dunaway
text: Loved this place!!  Awesome food and great staff. I'll definitely be back for more!!👍👍👍

name: Latoya Provens
text: Love there breakfast omelette's.

name: Eric Konecny
text:
Superb and open during Covid. Masks on til you get to the table of course, and we'll worth the time.
Don't forget to pick up a slice of cake to take home with you too!!!
The cakes here are seriously the best cakes I have been exposed to in my 43 years of living in Huntsville.

name: dareck harris
text: Awesome customer service. Huge portions. Delicious cakes. OMG

name: Arnita Cole
text:
The Godfather Chicken is delicious. The entree is enough for a second meal. The garden salad is fresh. Romaine lettuce is used instead of iceberg. The chicken noodle soup is tasty and NOT too salty.
You also get fresh bread,  garlic toast and cheesecake.

name: Malcolm Parsons (KI4KI)
text: Food was delicious. Service was fast, friendly, and accurate.

name: MV Freeman
text:
Went to the  City Cafe Diner tonight;  it's an interesting place.
It has a varied menu, but the food is filling, and good.
They bring warm bread with a cheese spread that has Italian type flavor - very tasty.
I had a Reuben wrap which was very good - nice and flavorful.
My husband had the zorba plate - a Greek sampler whuch included a gyro - very tasty.
There is so much food!!! We had to bring it home.
They are also known for there desserts (and no lie! Awesome!)
Now we had to try dessert but we couldn't eat it--we had to bring it home it was a Blondie: a cake layered with chocolate chip cookie base, cheese cake, cake... Wow!!
(Had to split it between three people there was no way to eat it all by yourself! We ate it the next day. Super sweet. Not sure I'd get another but it was very much worth trying)
The wait staff is friendly, and they make the visit enjoyable.
Only thing: repairs are needed. One chair was repaired with duct tape, although I appreciated the practicality of it.
I do recommend this place if you want hearty, tasty food.

name: Freedom Found Farm
text: Great food!! Excellent service!!

name: Denise Hammock
text:
It was excellent, their staff was great and the food was delicious, we will be back!! Thank you for allowing me to write a review!!
Keep up the good work and may God bless you all with many blessings....

name: Henry Reyna
text:
It's Christmas Day 2020 and they are open!

Friendly staff and great management team!!

Thank you!

name: Dennis Orr
text: Every time we eat there it is delicious

name: Nydia DeMarco
text: Plenty of delicious food and great customer service!

name: Devonna Powell
text: I ored the fried chicken which comes with mashed potatoes and gravy and green beans. Potatoes were excellent, chicken had no season and was bland, green beans really mushy. My husband ordered a burger from adult menu while my child ordered one from the kid menu. The burgers were the same size. If anything, my child's burger looked bigger. And both came with a side of fries. It looked like we ordered 2 adult plates. My husband said the burger had no flavor, but my child liked theirs. I was overall not impressed with the food. For the price, I expected superb tasting food. Most of the items were just bland and tasteless. However, like I said, the mashed potatoes were on point and the fries were excellent as well. I will also say portion sizes are huge

name: anadele desarme
